intro: Discolobium tocantinum, commonly known as the Tocantins discolobium, is a shrub native to the Brazilian state of Tocantins. It belongs to the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, which contributes to soil fertility in its native habitat. Due to its unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying plant adaptation in tropical regions.
